casebody.data:
MARGARET ARCHER, Respondent, v. LOUIS LEUBUSCHER, et al., Appellants.

Before Sedgwick, Speir and Freedman, JJ.

Decided May 3, 1880. Appeal by defendants from judgment and from order denying motion for new trial. Wm. J. A. McGrath, for appellants. D. & T. McMahon, for respondent. Per Curiam.

Upon examination of this case, we find no reason to disturb the verdict of the jury, or any ground of complaint against the charge of the judge.

The judgment and order must be affirmed, with costs.
